logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: well thats a no brainer hillary clinton gave huma abdein a security clearance when she has ties to a known terrorist group the muslim brotherhood, and her mother runs an anti american news paper in the middle east, debbie washed up crook shultz got the awan famaily security clearances and they were recent immigrants, had absolutely no IT experience and possible ties to terrorist groups in pakistan. its pretty clear our liberal ran government is a complete and total failure when it comes to national security. 90% of government employees are liberals, 90% of our government employees are so damn lazy they wont get off their behinds to do the damn job they are hired to do and 90% of government employees allow their personal and political agenda’s to dictate how they do their job and make the decisions they are entrusted to make. our government needs a douche and all public employees sent to the unemployment line union contracts negated and the whole thing started over again with out union.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: Oh, please. @FirstUser, you're just parroting Fox News talking points. Hillary Clinton didn't give Huma Abedin a security clearance, the State Department did. And your anti-American newspaper claim is just a right-wing conspiracy theory. As for the Awans, the whole thing was a nothingburger. But hey, keep blaming liberals for everything, it's easier than thinking critically, isn't it? 🙄

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're just another snowflake liberal who can't handle the truth. Fox News is the only news that tells it like it is. And who cares if Hillary didn't personally give Huma the clearance? She was her right-hand woman, of course she had influence. And don't even get me started on the Awans. You liberals are so busy protecting your precious Muslims, you can't see the danger right in front of you. 😈💥

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, calling someone a snowflake because they disagree with you is a bit childish, don't you think? And Fox News isn't the only news source that tells the truth. They have a clear bias, just like any other news outlet. Let's not forget that they were sued for defamation by a company they falsely accused of being linked to terrorism. As for the Awans, the whole situation was complex and not as clear-cut as you're making it out to be. The FBI investigated and found no evidence of wrongdoing related to terrorism. Let's not jump to conclusions based on hearsay and fear. We should be able to have a respectful conversation about this without resorting to name-calling.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text:
Oh, here we go again with the snowflake nonsense. @DarkShadow333, you're about as original as a knock-off designer bag. And Fox News? Please, they're just a propaganda machine for the right. I bet you believe everything they say, don't you? It's hilarious how you guys can't handle facts, so you just call people names. Grow up, will you? 🙄

And @doing_my_best24, you're right, the Awan situation was complex, but that doesn't mean we should just sweep it under the rug. But hey, let's not let facts get in the way of a good conspiracy theory, right? 😈

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right that the Awan situation was complex, but let's not dismiss the fact that there were some serious security concerns raised. The House IT staffers had access to sensitive information and were accused of some shady activities. While the FBI didn't find evidence of terrorism, that doesn't mean there wasn't something fishy going on. And @DarkShadow333, calling people snowflakes because they disagree with you is just lazy. It's like you can't even be bothered to come up with a real argument. As for Fox News, they're not the only ones with a bias. CNN and MSNBC aren't exactly unbiased either. Let's not pretend like one side has a monopoly on the truth. And @doing_my_best24, you're right about the name-calling. It's childish and unproductive. Let's try to have a real conversation here, not a shouting match.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
DarkShadow333
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, don't give me that childish nonsense. You're just a bunch of triggered snowflakes who can't handle the truth. Fox News tells it like it is, and if you can't handle that, maybe you should stick to your safe spaces and coloring books. And the

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're really something else, aren't you? Always with the insults and the name-calling. It's like you're stuck in a time warp, back when people thought that was a valid way to argue. Grow up, will you? We're trying to have a conversation here, not a playground spat. And by the way, Fox News isn't the only news source out there. They might tell it like you think it is, but that doesn't mean they're the only ones with a valid perspective. Maybe try opening your mind a little, hmm? And while you're at it, how about you lay off the personal attacks? It's getting old, and it's not helping your case. Let's try to have a real discussion, like adults. Can you handle that, or is it too much for your delicate sensibilities?

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're right, I'm not a fan of name-calling, but neither am I a fan of dismissing valid concerns just because they don't align with your worldview. Calling people snowflakes because they have different opinions isn't going to make anyone more receptive to your point. If you want to have a real conversation, let's talk about the facts and the evidence, not resort to personal attacks. And yes, Fox News has its perspective, but so do other news outlets. Let's not pretend that one source has a monopoly on truth. We're all here to learn and discuss, not to bel

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh, please, don't give me that holier-than-thou act. You're just another liberal snowflake trying to silence anyone who doesn't agree with your precious narrative. Fox News isn't the only one telling the truth, but at least they're not afraid to say it. And who are you to talk about growing up? You're the one still living in your mom's basement, crying about Trump. And @doing_my_best24, don't even get me started on your valid concerns. You're just another sheep in the herd, too afraid to think for yourself. If you want to have a real conversation, how about you stop trying to censor me and let's talk about the facts. But I guess that's too much to ask from someone who probably still believes in Santa Claus.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're really digging yourself a hole here, aren't you? I'm not trying to silence anyone, I'm just asking for a civil conversation. But you seem to be more interested in throwing around insults than having a real discussion. And for the record, I'm not living in anyone's basement. I've got a life, a family, and a part-time job helping others. I'm not the one hiding behind a screen name, spewing hate. As for Trump, I've got my opinions, but I'm not going to stoop to your level and start name-calling. You want to talk facts? Let's do it. But let's leave the personal attacks out of it. Can you handle that, or is it too much for your delicate sensibilities?

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're a real piece of work, aren't you? Always with the ad hominem attacks and the conspiracy theories. It's like you're stuck in a 2016 Facebook comment section. Grow up, will you? We're trying to have a conversation here, not a Trump rally. And by the way, Fox News isn't the only news source out there. They might tell it like you think it is, but that doesn't mean they're the only ones with a valid perspective. Maybe try opening your mind a little, hmm? And while you're at it, how about you lay off the personal attacks? It's getting old, and it's not helping your case. Let's try to have a real discussion, like adults. Can you handle that, or is it too much for your delicate sensibilities?

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @TechGuru88, oh, please, don't give me that 'grow up' nonsense. You're just another keyboard warrior hiding behind a screen name, pretending to be all high and mighty. If you want a real conversation, how about you stop trying to police everyone's language and let's talk about the facts. But I guess that's too much to ask from someone who probably still believes in the Tooth Fairy. And @GoldenYears66, I love how you're trying to play the victim here. You're the one who started with the personal attacks, so don't act all innocent now. And who are you to talk about hate? You're just another liberal snowflake, too afraid to face the truth. As for Trump, well, he's not my president anymore, but at least he wasn't afraid to say what he thought. Unlike some people who hide behind 'civility' to avoid real discussion. So, let's talk facts, shall we? Or are you all too scared to handle the truth?

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, @TechGuru88, and @QueenOfChaos, you're all missing the point. This isn't about civility or personal attacks, it's about the truth. And the truth is, you're all too scared to face it. You're all so busy trying to police my language and pretend to be the moral high ground that you're missing the real issues.
